member.name: T:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache
member.summary: This class tracks the first n letters of each peptide sent to it, while also tracking the peptides and the location of those peptides in the leader sequence hash table

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.PeptideSequenceInfo.PeptideSequence
member.summary: Peptide amino acids (stored as uppercase letters)

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.PeptideSequenceInfo.PeptideSequenceLtoI
member.summary: Peptide sequence where leucines have been changed to isoleucine
member.remarks: Only used if mIgnoreILDifferences is True

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.PeptideSequenceInfo.PrefixLtoI
member.summary: Prefix residue; if leucine, changed to isoleucine
member.remarks: Only used if mIgnoreILDifferences is True

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.PeptideSequenceInfo.SuffixLtoI
member.summary: Suffix residue; if leucine, changed to isoleucine
member.remarks: Only used if mIgnoreILDifferences is True

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.PeptideSequenceInfo.ToString
member.summary: Show the peptide sequence, including prefix and suffix

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.mLeaderSequences
member.summary: Keys in this dictionary are peptides, values are the corresponding index in mCachedPeptideToHashIndexPointer

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.mProgressPercentComplete
member.remarks: Value between 0 and 100, but can contain decimal percentage values

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.IgnoreILDifferences
member.summary: When true, treat I and L residues equally

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.ProgressPercentComplete
member.remarks: Value between 0 and 100, but can contain decimal percentage values

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.CachePeptide(System.String,System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Caches the peptide and updates mLeaderSequences
member.param: Set this to false if this is a duplicate entry for a given scan number (e.g. different protein, or not the top scoring peptide)

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.DetermineShortestPeptideLengthInFile(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Char,System.Int32)
member.summary: Parse the input file, examining column number columnNumWithPeptideSequence to determine the minimum peptide sequence length present Updates mLeaderSequenceMinimumLength if successful, though the minimum length is not allowed to be less than MINIMUM_LEADER_SEQUENCE_LENGTH
member.param: Should be 1 if the peptide sequence is in the first column, 2 if in the second, etc.
member.returns: True if success, false if an error

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.GetFirstPeptideIndexForLeaderSequence(System.String)
member.summary: Looks up the first index value in mCachedPeptideSeqInfo that matches leaderSequenceToFind
member.returns: The index value if found, or -1 if not found

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsLeaderSequenceCache.GetNextPeptideWithLeaderSequence(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the next peptide with the given leader sequence

member.name: T:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProgressChangedEventHandler
member.param: Value between 0 and 100, but can contain decimal percentage values

member.name: T:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer
member.summary: This class will read in a protein FASTA file or delimited protein info file along with an accompanying file with peptide sequences and compute the percent coverage of each of the proteins

member.summary: ProcessingOptions section of the XML file

member.summary: Protein description column number in the output file

member.summary: Protein sequence column number in the output file

member.summary: Suffix residue column name in the _ProteinToPeptideMapping.txt file

member.name: T:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageProcessingSteps
member.remarks: If you add/remove any steps, update PERCENT_COMPLETE_LEVEL_COUNT and update the population of mPercentCompleteStartLevels()

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageProcessingSteps.SaveAllProteinsVersionOfInputFile
member.summary: Saving the all proteins version of the input file

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.mPercentCompleteStartLevels
member.summary: Array that lists the percent complete value to report at the start of each of the various processing steps performed in this procedure
member.remarks: The percent complete values range from 0 to 100

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.mProgressPercentComplete
member.remarks: Value between 0 and 100, but can contain decimal percentage values

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProgressPercentComplete
member.remarks: Value between 0 and 100, but can contain decimal percentage values

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinToPeptideMappingFilePath
member.summary: Protein to peptide map file path

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.CapitalizeMatchingProteinSequenceLetters(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Look for the peptide sequence in the given protein sequence
member.param: Key to use with dictionary mProteinPeptideStats when Options.TrackPeptideCounts is true
Peptide prefix residue; only used if Options.MatchPeptidePrefixAndSuffixToProtein is true
Peptide suffix residue; only used if Options.MatchPeptidePrefixAndSuffixToProtein is true
Output: true if the protein sequence contains the peptide
Output: true if this is a new match (but will always be true if Options.TrackPeptideCounts is false)
Start residue number of the peptide in the protein (the first residue in the protein is 1); 0 if no match
End residue number of the peptide in the protein; 0 if no match
member.returns: Protein sequence, with letters capitalized if Options.SearchAllProteinsSkipCoverageComputationSteps is false

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ConstructOutputFilePath(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Construct the output file path The output file is based on outputFileBaseName if defined, otherwise is based on inputFilePath with the suffix removed In either case, suffixToAppend is appended The Output directory is based on outputDirectoryPath if defined, otherwise it is the directory where inputFilePath resides

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.FindColumnIndex(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Look for the columnToFind in the first non-blank line of the input file
member.param: When true, look for a column that starts with columnName if an exact match is not found
member.returns: Zero-base column index, or -1 if not found

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.FindColumnIndex(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String},System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Look for the first column whose name matches columnToFind
member.param: When true, look for a column that starts with columnName if an exact match is not found
member.returns: Column index if found, or -1 if not found

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.FindSequenceMatchForPeptideList(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Searches for proteins that contain the peptides in peptideList If proteinNameForPeptide is blank or mSearchAllProteinsForPeptideSequence=True, searches all proteins Otherwise, only searches the protein specified by proteinNameForPeptide
member.param: Dictionary containing the peptides to search; peptides must be in the format Prefix.Peptide.Suffix where Prefix and Suffix are single characters; peptides are assumed to only contain letters (no symbols)
The protein to search; only used if mSearchAllProteinsForPeptideSequence=False

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.mSymbolMatcher
member.summary: RegEx to match any character that is not a letter

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.mBracketModsMatcher
member.summary: RegEx to match modifications of the form [15.9998] or [Acetyl]

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.GetCleanPeptideSequence(System.String,System.Char@,System.Char@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get the peptide sequence without the prefix and suffix, and optionally without modification symbols
member.param: Peptide sequence, optionally with prefix and suffix residues
Prefix residue, if present before a period in the second character
Suffix residue, if present after a period in the second to the last character
When true, look for and remove both bracket-based modifications (like [15.9998] or [Acetyl]) and symbols (like @, #, and $)

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.GetColumnValueIfNotEmpty(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String},System.Int32,System.String@)
member.summary: Get the text in the column at the given index
member.param: Line parts after splitting a delimited data line
Output: value at index columnIndex in lineParts
member.returns: True if columnIndex is within range of the items in lineParts and if the value is not an empty string

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.GetErrorMessage
member.returns: Error message, or an empty string

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.GetOutputDirectoryPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determine the output directory path Uses outputDirectoryPath if defined Otherwise uses the directory where outputFilePath resides
member.remarks: If an error, or unable to determine a directory, returns the directory with the application files

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.IncrementCountByKey(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Int32},System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Increment the observation count for the given key in the given dictionary If the key is not defined, add it
member.param: Dictionary where values are the item count for each key
Set this to false if this is a duplicate entry for a given scan number (e.g. different protein, or not the top scoring peptide)
member.returns: True if the protein is new and was added to mProteinPeptideStats

member.summary: Load settings from an XML-based parameter file
member.returns: True if success (including if parameterFilePath is an empty string), false if an error

member.summary: Process the file to compute protein sequence coverage
member.param: When true, reset the error code
member.returns: True if success, false if an error

member.summary: Process the file to compute protein sequence coverage
member.param: When true, reset the error code
Protein to peptide map file path
member.returns: True if success, false if an error

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ReadProteinInfoChunk(System.Int32,System.Boolean[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Read the next chunk of proteins from the database (SequenceID, ProteinName, ProteinSequence)

member.name: M:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.clsProteinCoverageSummarizer.ValidateColumnCountInInputFile(System.String,ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.PeptideFileColumnOrderingCode@,System.Boolean,System.Char)
member.summary: Read the first two lines to check whether the data file actually has only one column when the user has specified Options.PeptideFileFormatCode = PeptideFileColumnOrderingCode.ProteinName_PeptideSequence If Options.PeptideFileFormatCode is PeptideFileColumnOrderingCode.SequenceOnly, the file isn't even opened
member.param: When true, skip the first line
member.returns: True if no problems; False if the user chooses to abort

member.summary: Write cached peptide lines to the source plus all proteins data file
member.param: Lines read from the PSM results file; Keys are the text of each line and values are the protein name for that line
Total number of lines read from the input file

member.summary: Protein caching progress event handler delegate

member.summary: This class will read a protein FASTA file or delimited protein info file and store the proteins in memory

member.remarks: Index number applied to the proteins stored in the SQLite DB; the first protein has UniqueSequenceID = 0

member.summary: SQLite Connection String and file path

member.summary: Constructor that accepts an options class

member.summary: Get the total number of cached proteins

member.summary: Get the list of cached proteins

member.summary: Examines the file's extension and true if it ends in .fasta or .fsa or .faa

member.summary: Parse a protein file to cache proteins

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.PeptideFileColumnOrderingCode.SequenceOnly
member.summary: The first column is peptide sequence; ignore other columns

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.PeptideFileColumnOrderingCode.ProteinName_PeptideSequence
member.summary: Protein name in the first column, peptide sequence in the second column

member.summary: Examine header names to find the peptide and protein columns

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.IgnoreILDifferences
member.summary: When true, treat I and L residues equally

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.KeepDB
member.summary: When this is True, the SQLite Database will not be deleted after processing finishes

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.MapFileIncludesPrefixAndSuffixColumns
member.summary: When true, add columns Prefix and Suffix to the protein to peptide map file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.MatchPeptidePrefixAndSuffixToProtein
member.summary: When true, require that each peptide's prefix and suffix letters match the protein sequence

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.OutputProteinSequence
member.summary: When true, include the protein sequence in the protein coverage output file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.PeptideFileSkipFirstLine
member.summary: When true, skip the first line of the peptide file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.PeptideInputFileDelimiter
member.summary: Peptide file column delimiter (default is tab)

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.RemoveSymbolCharacters
member.summary: When true, remove symbol characters from peptide sequences (default is true)

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.SaveProteinToPeptideMappingFile
member.summary: Save the protein to peptide map file
member.remarks: The filename is auto-defined as the input file name, but with suffix _ProteinToPeptideMapping.txt

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.SaveSourceDataPlusProteinsFile
member.summary: Create a new file that matches the input file, but has protein name appended
member.remarks: The filename is auto-defined as the input file name, but with suffix _AllProteins.txt

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.SearchAllProteinsForPeptideSequence
member.summary: When true, search all proteins for each peptide, ignoring any protein names listed in the input file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.SearchAllProteinsSkipCoverageComputationSteps
member.summary: When true, skip coverage computation steps (saves memory)

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinCoverageSummarizerOptions.UseLeaderSequenceHashTable
member.summary: Use the leader sequence hash table (dramatically speeds up the search)

member.name: F:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.mDelimitedInputFileDelimiter
member.summary: Delimiter character for delimited protein files
member.remarks: Only used for delimited protein input files, not for FASTA files

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.AssumeDelimitedFile
member.summary: When True, assume the input file is a tab-delimited text file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.AssumeFastaFile
member.summary: When True, assume the input file is a FASTA text file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.ChangeProteinSequencesToLowercase
member.summary: When true, change protein sequences to lowercase

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.ChangeProteinSequencesToUppercase
member.summary: When true, change protein sequences to uppercase

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.DelimitedInputFileDelimiter
member.summary: Delimiter character for delimited protein files

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.DelimitedFileSkipFirstLine
member.summary: When true, skip the first line of a delimited protein file

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.KeepDB
member.summary: When this is True, the SQLite Database will not be deleted after processing finishes

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.RemoveSymbolCharacters
member.summary: When true, remove symbol characters from proteins

member.name: P:ProteinCoverageSummarizer.ProteinDataCacheOptions.IgnoreILDifferences
member.summary: When true, treat I and L residues equally
